    "body": "\r\n#### Pull request checklist\r\n\r\n- [ ] Addresses an existing issue: Fixes partially #19106\r\n- [ ] Include a change request file using `$ yarn change`\r\n\r\n#### Description of changes\r\n\r\nAdds a new `version-string-replace` generator to match parts of a\r\nversion string for a package and replace it with someone else.\r\n\r\nAny version string changes will be applied to all dependent packages'\r\n`package.json` dependencies and dev dependencies`\r\n\r\nTested to be able to:\r\n- Migrate `9.0.0-alpha.x` -> `9.0.0-beta.0`\r\n- Remove prerelease tags `9.0.0-beta.69` -> `9.0.0`\r\n\r\n#### Focus areas to test\r\n\r\n(optional)\r\n",

    "body": "#### Pull request checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] Include a change request file using `$ yarn change`\r\n\r\n#### Description of changes\r\n\r\nFully migrate `ContextualMenu` to be a functional component.     "body": "#### Pull request checklist\r\n\r\n- [x] Addresses an existing issue: Fixes https://dev.azure.com/microsoftdesign/fluent-ui/_workitems/edit/12482\r\n- [x] Include a change request file using `$ yarn change`\r\n\r\n#### Description of changes\r\n\r\nThe `<FocusZone />` component exposes `shouldRaiseClicks` which defines behaviour for both <kbd>Space</kbd> and <kbd>Enter</kbd> keys. The events were not propagating properly because `shouldRaiseClicks` was disabled for `<DetailsList />` as it was breaking other behaviour.\r\n\r\nI split the flag into two separate ones without introducing a breaking change into the API and updated it where needed.\r\n\r\n#### Focus areas to test\r\n\r\n- `<FocusZone />` component\r\n- `<DetailsList />` component\r\n- `onItemInvoked` prop on the `<DetailsList />` component\r\n",

    "body": "Sets overflow to hidden on Attachment so the progress bar stays within the rounded corners.\r\n\r\n*Before*\r\n![overflowing progress bar](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2564094/132728668-ecdde61b-2bd2-4ba6-8c31-278aa2c38375.png)\r\n\r\n*After*\r\n![rounded progress bar](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2564094/132728690-2511bf06-29f3-4841-a8ab-82d37764f0f1.png)\r\n\r\n\r\nAlso cleans up some Attachment examples to be more focused and move from Class to Function Components.\r\n",

    "body": "#### Pull request checklist\r\n\r\n~~- [ ] Addresses an existing issue: Fixes #0000~~\r\n- [x] Include a change request file using `$ yarn change`\r\n\r\n#### Description of changes\r\n\r\nThe previous implementation of the Image included the conditional adding of `aria-hidden` based on the presence of the `alt` or `aria-label` attributes. This is not considered a good practice, thus removing it. \r\n\r\nImages are expected to have the `alt` attribute description, or to be added other aria attributes explicitly from the user to confirm that the particular image is decorative only.\r\n\r\n",

    "title": "(vr-tests) - Enabling converged components to test RTL through config prop",

      "login": "czearing",

    },
    "body": "#### Pull request checklist\r\n- [X] Include a change request file using `$ yarn change`\r\n\r\n#### Description of changes\r\n\r\nEnabling converged components to use RTL VR tests similar to the previous Fabric provider through a config.\r\nThis is done by removing the `FluentProviderDecorator` and automatically populating incoming stories through the preview.js file with the corresponding props. \r\n\r\n```jsx\r\n  .addStory('Default', () => <Button>Hello, world</Button>, { rtl: true })\r\n```\r\n\r\nTo determine whether a component uses the FluentProvider the preview.js file will look for either two cases:\r\n1. The story name contains Next\r\n2. The story's config contains `config.provider === 'FluentProvider'`\r\n\r\n\r\n",
